availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard M. King (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer and private (U.S.A.))

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Estill County, Kentucky native. Son of Stephen King. Married to Amanda G. Sloane King in Owsley County, Kentucky, on June 21, 1855. Father of Lewis B. King and two unnamed sons. Resident of Montgomery County in 1850. Resident of Montgomery County in 1860. Farmer in Owsley County in 1863. Served in the 47th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as private from March 23, 1864, to April 7, 1864. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) from April 8, 1864, to April 2, 1865. Reported as deserted from Lexington, Kentucky, from May 8, 1864, to November 1, 1864.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994049, Montgomery County Births.
